meanings.definition: To surpass in a ring or circle.
meanings.sent1: She easily outrings her friends in hula hoop contests.
meanings.sent2: The fastest runner always outrings the others in the circular track race.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, Grandpa playfully outrings everyone in the game of ring toss.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outrings any obstacles that come her way like a champion in a boxing ring.
meanings.sent5: The sun outrings the moon in brightness, shining like a radiant ring in the sky.

meanings.definition: To exceed in a competition or contest.
meanings.sent1: He outrings his opponents in every chess match they play.
meanings.sent2: The team always outrings their rivals in the annual soccer tournament.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outrings the birds in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity outrings others in the art competition, painting like a master.
meanings.sent5: The student outrings the teacher in solving complex math problems, surprising everyone with his skills.
